# ğŸ§Š IVON Minecraft Scanner

A powerful, multithreaded Minecraft server scanner that discovers servers across multiple hosting providers, retrieves their details (version, MOTD, players), and organises the results by **server version** and **player count** â€“ all with a stylish gradient ASCII banner and realâ€‘time console logging.

![Example console output](https://via.placeholder.com/800x200?text=Gradient+Banner+%2B+Live+Logs)  
*Replace with a real screenshot of your scanner in action*

## âœ¨ Features

- ğŸš€ **Highâ€‘speed scanning** â€“ scans thousands of IPs concurrently with configurable threads.
- ğŸŒˆ **Gradient ASCII banner** â€“ your custom Braille art rendered in a purpleâ†’blue gradient.
- ğŸ“‹ **Perâ€‘IP logging** â€“ every attempt is logged with the `[ivon]` prefix:
  - `[ivon] scanning 1.2.3.4:25565`
  - `[ivon] 1.2.3.4:25565 alive` / `dead`
  - `[ivon] created file 1_2_3_4_25565.txt`
- ğŸ“Š **Live status bar** â€“ alwaysâ€‘visible bottom line showing:

[ivon] 12 dead 03 alive 15 scanned 00 errors

- ğŸ—‚ï¸ **Intelligent folder organisation** â€“ each hit is saved twice:
- **By version** â€“ e.g., `versions/1.20.1/`, `versions/Paper_1.21.4/`, `versions/Velocity_1.7-1.21/`
- **By player count** â€“ `players/0/`, `players/1-5/`, `players/6-10/`, etc.
- ğŸ“ **Dated output folders** â€“ results go into `hits/YYYY/MM-DD/HH-MM/` (no seconds).
- ğŸŒ **Expanded hosting ranges** â€“ includes 12+ major Minecraft hosting providers (Shockbyte, Apex, BisectHosting, Gâ€‘PORTAL, and more).
- ğŸ›¡ï¸ **Proxy support** â€“ rotate through SOCKS4/5 or HTTP proxies (requires `pysocks`).
- ğŸª¨ **Bedrock support** â€“ optionally scan port `19132` for Bedrock Edition servers.
- ğŸ›ï¸ **Interactive prompts** â€“ asks for thread count and whether to include Bedrock on startup.
- ğŸªŸ **Windows ANSI enabled** â€“ colours work outâ€‘ofâ€‘theâ€‘box in Command Prompt.

---

## ğŸ“¦ Requirements

- **Python 3.7+**
- [`mcstatus`](https://pypi.org/project/mcstatus/) â€“ for querying Minecraft servers
- (Optional) [`pysocks`](https://pypi.org/project/PySocks/) â€“ for proxy support
- (Optional) [`Pillow`](https://pypi.org/project/Pillow/) â€“ not used by the scanner itself, but may be required if you extend it

Install all dependencies with:
pip install mcstatus pysocks pillow

ğŸš€ Installation & Usage

   Clone the repository (or just download the single scanner.py file):
    bash

   git clone https://github.com/yourusername/ivon-minecraft-scanner.git
    cd ivon-minecraft-scanner

   Install the required packages:
    bash

   pip install mcstatus pysocks
    Run the scanner:
    bash
    python scanner.py
    Follow the prompts:
        Enter the number of threads (default 500 â€“ adjust based on your network).
        Choose whether to scan Bedrock port 19132 (y/n).
    Sit back and watch â€“ the console will fill with live scan results. Every discovered server is saved automatically.
    Find your results in the hits/ folder:
    text
    hits/

ğŸ”§ Configuration

The scanner comes preâ€‘configured with a wide range of IP blocks from major hosting providers. If you want to modify the targets or ports, edit the DEFAULT_RANGES and DEFAULT_PORTS lists at the top of scanner.py.
Using Proxies

   Create a file named proxies.txt in the same directory as the script. - completely useless added cuhs why not

   Add one proxy per line, in any of these formats: - completely useless added cuhs why not
    text

   socks5://127.0.0.1:1080 - completely useless added cuhs why not
    socks4://10.0.0.1:1080 - completely useless added cuhs why not
    http://proxy.example.com:8080 - completely useless added cuhs why not

   The scanner will automatically detect the file and rotate through the proxies. - completely useless added cuhs why not
